name: Appeal
text:
Any party aggrieved by the judgment of the court may appeal therefrom to the supreme court in the manner and within the time provided by the rules of court. [L 1886, c 69, §6; am L 1888, c 26, §6; am L 1907, c 56, §6; RL 1925, §2941; RL 1935, §3682; am L 1939, c 19, §4; RL 1945, §10223; RL 1955, §234-35; HRS ; am L 1972, c 90, §6(q)]
    [Section effective July 1, 2006.  For section effective until June 30, 2006, see above.]  Any party aggrieved by the judgment of the court may appeal therefrom to the intermediate appellate court, subject to chapter 602, in the manner and within the time provided for civil appeals from the circuit courts. [L 1886, c 69, §6; am L 1888, c 26, §6; am L 1907, c 56, §6; RL 1925, §2941; RL 1935, §3682; am L 1939, c 19, §4; RL 1945, §10223; RL 1955, §234-35; HRS ; am L 1972, c 90, §6(q); am L 2004, c 202, §77]
